meanings.definition: To excessively promote or advertise something.
meanings.sent1: The company overpromotes their products, making them seem better than they really are.
meanings.sent2: She always overpromotes her events, but they never turn out as exciting as she claims.
meanings.sent3: He overpromotes his cooking skills, but his burnt toast tells a different story.
meanings.sent4: The politician overpromotes his achievements, but the truth always comes out in the end.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overpromotes the importance of studying, but some students still don't take it seriously.

meanings.definition: To give excessive praise or attention to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The coach overpromotes his star player, ignoring the efforts of the rest of the team.
meanings.sent2: She overpromotes her favorite singer, claiming they are the best in the world.
meanings.sent3: He overpromotes his cat's hunting skills, even though it only catches toy mice.
meanings.sent4: The boss overpromotes his assistant, failing to see the mistakes she makes.
meanings.sent5: The parent overpromotes their child's artwork, hanging every scribble on the fridge.
